website_summaries.verdict: The AAXA P450 Pico Projector is small and light and has a wide range of connection choices.
cons: Shows scaling artifacts at native resolution

customer_reviews.title: Build Quality felt good...but it did not work
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I got a bad one or not, but the unit randomly shuts down. At times freezes up and wont do anything, and I have to pull the power to turn off. Returned. When it did work, picture quality was decent. Must be used in a very low light/ no light environment. The stand that it comes with is extremely flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Selby P

customer_reviews.title: Great while it worked
customer_reviews.text: I bought this projector almost 4 years ago. It worked quite well for me...while it worked. Now it won't recognize jpg images loaded onto a USB stick, which is what I've always used it for. I've tried 4 different sticks, including a brand new one, and it just sends error messages: "all files unsupported". One time, for one USB stick, it showed me images but the wrong ones. I'm disgusted that I spent $400 on a product that didn't even last 4 years. And that's not with heavy use, either. I used it probably 3-4 times a year. It wasn't a daily thing. Pathetic.
customer_reviews.author: Connecticut person

customer_reviews.title: This is the best ever! So very small that you could carry ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best ever! So very small that you could carry it in a shoulder bag. Very clear images. Easy, easy to set up. Took it on a plane about 5 hours after it arrived without taking it out of the box. Set it up, plugged it in and there it was on the screen. Fantastic!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Bunch

customer_reviews.title: Randomly shutting itself off for no apparent reason and the speaker doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work fine as long as it's not randomly shutting itself off for no apparent reason. It's not running hot when it happens, and it shuts down anywhere between the first 30 minutes to 60 minutes of operating (almost every time). When I turn it back on, it works fine. When I spoke to tech support at AAXA, I was told to keep using it and see if it stopped turning itself off...(really)? Also, the speakers that came with my Super Bundle Pack (paid more for this), started making crackling noises the first night we used it! I've had to use other speakers when using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2nd AAXA projector
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased the P2 model and used it frequently for 2 years. As movies outside, referred to as Driveway Drive In began to be more popular, we made some upgrades. Screen, soundbar, etc. I was looking to upgrade and this model, the pro, fit my needs well. We have a 103" screen and this looks beautiful. Ambient light was an issue before with the P2, however the 450 pro keeps a clean and visible picture even with some lights. The bluetooth functionality is great with the soundbar. Only gripes are the on off switch and the plug.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last
customer_reviews.text: Update: It's only been 16 months and it's konked out. The lamp it seem blew. The company says that the lamp should last 15,000 hours, but we've used it only about 5 hours a day (approximately 2400 hours). since they only guarantee it for 1 year, all they told me was they'd sell me another one for a reduced price! to me this was $450 down the drain. Expected it to last a few years at least. Save your money get an Epson instead. They back up their products better.
customer_reviews.author: Painterroy

customer_reviews.title: Great Even In Full-Size Conference Rooms
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for work. Major tech consulting firm, the sales team I am on often found itself in an unexpected place needing to look at documents together or with a client. I picked this one because it listed lots of lumens and had good reviews. OMG, this tiny projector is awesome. I am in a big conference room right now and we are projecting from about 15' away to a pull-down screen, I'm guessing it's 90" diagonal.This projector is up to the task. We have lights off over the screen, lights in the back of the room on, and shades closed. We can see the image clearly. We've used it in a variety of situations, it is always amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Timay

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I was initially concerned as to how well such a small unit will perform as compared to a full sized projector; I'm using it for small group presentations for staff, so didn't want to have a large projector taking up room. I'm impressed with the brightness and clarity of such a small portable device; it exceeds an older full size projector in brightness and image quality. The only downside is the tinny sounding speakers, although I didn't have much expectations in that front, and do have another portable speaker for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: PHL

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased customer
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price, I bought this aaxa P450 for movie nights with the family and I project it straight on the wall and it works great. Focusing was not that bad either and now it is like having a movie theater in my living room. I would recommend this device to people. My only problem came with the delivery the first one I never received and was upset but Amazon fixed that problem. This is a great little projector for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bonney

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: The projector was everything I expected - portable, relatively bright, powered usb, and had a low fan volume. My biggest issue was with the speakers which were weak and distorted at higher volumes. Ultimately, I experienced a problem with the HDMI input (the video glitched and sound crackled) and had to return the projector, however, would still recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: D. Duong

customer_reviews.title: Love this little projector
customer_reviews.text: Love this little projector. Had to purchase a few adapters for Apple products and works best with external speaker like bluetooth. All in all spent about $600 for projector and hook ups, but we use it all the time. Makes movie time fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works real well. I wish it run on batteries ...
customer_reviews.text: Works real well. I wish it run on batteries - I didn't realize that it needs to be plugged all the time. My mistake. I should read more carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Pavel N. Matustik

customer_reviews.title: this ting is a beast, it does the job ...
customer_reviews.text: this ting is a beast, it does the job of larger projectors, my sales team loves it for the small form factor, this is a sales team necessity. A+++
customer_reviews.author: RIVER ROAD WASTE

customer_reviews.title: I wish one more HDMI and one Optical cable makes it wonderful projector.
customer_reviews.text: A very well made projector with many features, I wish one more HDMI and one Optical cable makes it wonderful projector.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: small and compact.
customer_reviews.text: Fits into the palm of my hand and has a great image. It was exactly what I needed as I was looking for a projector that was small, compact and could travel.
customer_reviews.author: HSB

customer_reviews.title: This projector has excellent image quality and contrast - does need a power ...
customer_reviews.text: This projector has excellent image quality and contrast - does need a power source unlike some of the small projector, but makes up for it through much more contrast. I used it in a regular conference room (not darkened) with a distance of 10-15 feet between screen and projector.
customer_reviews.author: Joachim P.

customer_reviews.title: Business Class Portable Projector
customer_reviews.text: Works Great For Such A Small Projector, Best Picture Is In A Dark Room
customer_reviews.author: Richard J Ulrich

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!!  Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time and as described. Thank you! Great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: NBH

customer_reviews.title: Functional projector
customer_reviews.text: This device works well for small presentations. The picture is good. Getting to the root menu is cumbersome. Great for camping outs in Awning with walls.
customer_reviews.author: AradoBlue

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me! I'm using this to transfer images to large canvases. Clear and bright even in full daylight in my studio.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Calderone

customer_reviews.title: Great projector
customer_reviews.text: Great projector does everything it suppose to. The only thing is it will go out of focus as the unit heats up. Easy fix just adjust the focus wheel no biggy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is okay - It lacks wireless connectivity which is common now aday .
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Ngo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good project and small and light but remote doesn't work - can you send new remote or battery?!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but some defects.
customer_reviews.text: Good but always out of focus automatically when using, need to manually adjust it constantly. And also no horizontal key stoning is not that good.
customer_reviews.author: Denton

customer_reviews.title: A great projector!
customer_reviews.text: While it is a little loud, the p-450 is a great piece of equipment. 450 lumons is more than bright enough for a dark room and even shows better than I expected it a lit room. Don't even think about using the built in speaker but it has an aux port for that. If you're thinking about getting this projector, go ahead. It's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Howell

customer_reviews.title: This is a surprisingly good projector given it's diminutive size
customer_reviews.text: This is a surprisingly good projector given it's diminutive size! Best for smaller rooms with the ability to dim lights. Image is clear with good color. Projected images are sharp, writing is crisp and legible. I used this in two different classrooms every day for a week and am absolutely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Angela R.

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from Aaxa!
customer_reviews.text: The focus dial stopped working for me in less than a week of very moderate use (not even daily). I wrote customer service two days ago, and there's still no response. I really regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ma'ayan B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Can't ask for anything more from a projector this size for this price. I am currently deployed in the military and this projector proves to be amazing. Awesome bright colors and 1080p resolution is great. Paired it with the Bose mini and it's like having a portable home theater. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Ok!
customer_reviews.text: Focus not as good as I would have expected and would have preferred it come with a clicker that advances slides !
customer_reviews.author: djbman

customer_reviews.title: A piece of crap- Light turned yellow in less than 2 year
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of crap!. In less than 2 years of occasional use, the light turned yellow (even though it says 15000hours of life time), when I called the support, they asked me to buy a new unit. I won't recommend this at all.
customer_reviews.author: HPeer

customer_reviews.title: The projector is so lite and the tripod so unstable that it can easily fall to the floor
customer_reviews.text: It is a little difficult to focus while you are projecting. The projector is so lite and the tripod so unstable that it can easily fall to the floor. The AC/DC adapter got damage in lesa than 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Juan B. Giusti de Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Good product but the speaker is very bad
customer_reviews.text: Good product but the speaker is very bad. For two days of use the speaker was OK. But suddenly the speaker is giving a jarring sound along with audio. Looks like the speaker is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Manvith Kumbla

product_meta.title: AAXA P450 Pico/Micro Projector with LED, WXGA 1280x800 Resolution, 450 Lumens, Pocket Size, HDMI, Mini-VGA, 15,000 Hour LED Life, Media Player, DLP Projector
product_meta.description: Model:P450 (2014 Model)AAXA Technologies P450 DLP 450 Lumen Pico Pocket WXGA projector HDMI USB. 1280x800 Native Resolution. The P450 is capable of delivering up to 140" image in dark areas with its 15,000 hour LED. Full multi-media powerhouse the P450 features an onboard video / picture viewer, speakers, HDMI, VGA, and RCA connectivity., Provides an extensible design that enables. Design that delivers high availability, scalability, and for maximum flexibility and price/performance. The country of origin is China.
feature_bullets: HDMI, mini-VGA, Composite AV inputs, micro-SD-HC, USB readers
Media Player supports MP4, MP3, AVI, JPG,

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars71 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
